title: Police Beat
text:
Bullet strikes girl's bedroom window
A bullet struck a 10-year-old girl's bedroom window in Little Rock Saturday afternoon, authorities said.
The girl was in the bedroom of her home in the 1000 block of East 10th Street about 5:45 p.m. when the shot was fired, according to a report by the Little Rock Police Department. Police later found a bullet hole in her bedroom window and several casings on the street west of the home, the report states.
The girl's 76-year-old grandmother, who was also home at the time of the shooting, told police she did not see who fired the shots, according to the report.
Authorities said both the girl and her grandmother refused medical attention. The report does not indicate whether the girl was injured. A call to Little Rock police about the gunshots was not immediately returned Monday afternoon.
Walgreens in LR robbed at gunpoint
A Little Rock Walgreens was robbed at gunpoint on Saturday night, according to authorities.
Police said the robbery occurred about 8:20 p.m., when a male armed with a gun demanded money from a cashier at the location at 3901 W. Markham St., which is just east of UAMS Medical Center.
No suspects were named and no arrests had been made at the time of the report.
Metro on 10/30/2018
